PowerShell uses .Net Core API and does not directly check certificates. I guess it is either local issue or .Net Core issue You could try to manually check the certificate with Verify() method https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.security.cryptography.x509certificates.x509certificate2.verify?view=netcore-3.1
X509Certificate2.Verify Method (System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates)

Performs a X.509 chain validation using basic validation policy.
